p: IAV-laden particles were mainly detected in air on teaching days than on holidays ( Figure 3A). A(H1N1) RNA was detected sporadically in air during the study period while there was also limited A(H1N1) activity in the community ( Figure 3B). A(H3N2) RNA was detected in air on campus prior to the 2017 summer epidemic of A(H3N2), but we did not sample during the peak of the community epidemic, and no A(H3N2) RNA was detected after the epidemic ( Figure 3C). Similarly, IBV RNA was detected in airborne particles on campus prior to the 2017–2018 winter epidemic of IBV but not afterwards ( Figure 3D). We continued to sample air on campus during the IBV epidemic in winter 2017–2018, but IBV RNA was only detected at low frequency on campus, probably due to reduced student activities during the winter holidays.
